speaker: PISTOL
text: Qui vous là?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: A friend.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Discuss unto me: art thou officer or art thou

speaker: PISTOL
text: base, common, and popular?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: I am a gentleman of a company.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Trail’st thou the puissant pike?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Even so. What are you?

speaker: PISTOL
text: As good a gentleman as the Emperor.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Then you are a better than the King.

speaker: PISTOL
text: The King’s a bawcock and a heart of gold, a lad

speaker: PISTOL
text: of life, an imp of fame, of parents good, of fist most

speaker: PISTOL
text: valiant. I kiss his dirty shoe, and from heartstring I

speaker: PISTOL
text: love the lovely bully. What is thy name?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Harry le Roy.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Le Roy? A Cornish name. Art thou of Cornish

speaker: PISTOL
text: crew?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: No, I am a Welshman.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Know’st thou Fluellen?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Yes.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Tell him I’ll knock his leek about his pate upon

speaker: PISTOL
text: Saint Davy’s day.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Do not you wear your dagger in your cap

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: that day, lest he knock that about yours.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Art thou his friend?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: And his kinsman too.

speaker: PISTOL
text: The figo for thee then!

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: I thank you. God be with you.

speaker: PISTOL
text: My name is Pistol called.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: It sorts well with your fierceness.

speaker: GOWER
text: Captain Fluellen.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: ’So. In the name of Jesu Christ, speak fewer.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: It is the greatest admiration in the universal world

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: when the true and aunchient prerogatifes and

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: laws of the wars is not kept. If you would take the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: pains but to examine the wars of Pompey the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Great, you shall find, I warrant you, that there is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: no tiddle taddle nor pibble babble in Pompey’s

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: camp. I warrant you, you shall find the ceremonies

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: of the wars and the cares of it and the forms

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: of it and the sobriety of it and the modesty of it to

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: be otherwise.

speaker: GOWER
text: Why, the enemy is loud. You hear him all

speaker: GOWER
text: night.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: If the enemy is an ass and a fool and a prating

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: coxcomb, is it meet, think you, that we should also,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: look you, be an ass and a fool and a prating

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: coxcomb, in your own conscience now?

speaker: GOWER
text: I will speak lower.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: I pray you and beseech you that you will.

speaker: COURT
text: Brother John Bates, is not that the morning

speaker: COURT
text: which breaks yonder?

speaker: BATES
text: I think it be, but we have no great cause to desire

speaker: BATES
text: the approach of day.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: We see yonder the beginning of the day, but

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: I think we shall never see the end of it.—Who goes

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: there?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: A friend.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: Under what captain serve you?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Under Sir Thomas Erpingham.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: A good old commander and a most kind

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: gentleman. I pray you, what thinks he of our

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: estate?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Even as men wracked upon a sand, that

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: look to be washed off the next tide.

speaker: BATES
text: He hath not told his thought to the King?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: No. Nor it is not meet he should, for,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: though I speak it to you, I think the King is but a

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: man as I am. The violet smells to him as it doth to

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: me. The element shows to him as it doth to me. All

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: his senses have but human conditions. His ceremonies

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: laid by, in his nakedness he appears but a man,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: and though his affections are higher mounted than

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: ours, yet when they stoop, they stoop with the like

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: wing. Therefore, when he sees reason of fears as we

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: do, his fears, out of doubt, be of the same relish as

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: ours are. Yet, in reason, no man should possess him

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: with any appearance of fear, lest he, by showing it,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: should dishearten his army.

speaker: BATES
text: He may show what outward courage he will,

speaker: BATES
text: but I believe, as cold a night as ’tis, he could wish

speaker: BATES
text: himself in Thames up to the neck; and so I would

speaker: BATES
text: he were, and I by him, at all adventures, so we were

speaker: BATES
text: quit here.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: By my troth, I will speak my conscience

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: of the King. I think he would not wish himself

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: anywhere but where he is.

speaker: BATES
text: Then I would he were here alone; so should he

speaker: BATES
text: be sure to be ransomed, and a many poor men’s

speaker: BATES
text: lives saved.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: I dare say you love him not so ill to wish

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: him here alone, howsoever you speak this to feel

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: other men’s minds. Methinks I could not die anywhere

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: so contented as in the King’s company, his

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: cause being just and his quarrel honorable.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: That’s more than we know.

speaker: BATES
text: Ay, or more than we should seek after, for we

speaker: BATES
text: know enough if we know we are the King’s subjects.

speaker: BATES
text: If his cause be wrong, our obedience to the

speaker: BATES
text: King wipes the crime of it out of us.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: But if the cause be not good, the King

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: himself hath a heavy reckoning to make, when all

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: those legs and arms and heads, chopped off in a

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: battle, shall join together at the latter day, and cry

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: all “We died at such a place,” some swearing, some

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: crying for a surgeon, some upon their wives left

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: poor behind them, some upon the debts they owe,

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: some upon their children rawly left. I am afeard

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: there are few die well that die in a battle, for how

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: can they charitably dispose of anything when blood

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: is their argument? Now, if these men do not die

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: well, it will be a black matter for the king that led

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: them to it, who to disobey were against all proportion

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: of subjection.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: So, if a son that is by his father sent about

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: merchandise do sinfully miscarry upon the sea,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: the imputation of his wickedness, by your rule,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: should be imposed upon his father that sent him.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Or if a servant, under his master’s command transporting

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: a sum of money, be assailed by robbers and

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: die in many irreconciled iniquities, you may call the

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: business of the master the author of the servant’s

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: damnation. But this is not so. The King is not bound

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: to answer the particular endings of his soldiers, the

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: father of his son, nor the master of his servant, for

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: they purpose not their death when they purpose

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: their services. Besides, there is no king, be his cause

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: never so spotless, if it come to the arbitrament of

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: swords, can try it out with all unspotted soldiers.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Some, peradventure, have on them the guilt of

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: premeditated and contrived murder; some, of beguiling

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: virgins with the broken seals of perjury;

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: some, making the wars their bulwark, that have

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: before gored the gentle bosom of peace with pillage

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: and robbery. Now, if these men have defeated the

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: law and outrun native punishment, though they can

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: outstrip men, they have no wings to fly from God.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: War is His beadle, war is His vengeance, so that here

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: men are punished for before-breach of the King’s

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: laws in now the King’s quarrel. Where they feared

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: the death, they have borne life away; and where they

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: would be safe, they perish. Then, if they die unprovided,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: no more is the King guilty of their damnation

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: than he was before guilty of those impieties for the

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: which they are now visited. Every subject’s duty is

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: the King’s, but every subject’s soul is his own.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Therefore should every soldier in the wars do as

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: every sick man in his bed: wash every mote out of

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: his conscience. And, dying so, death is to him

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: advantage; or not dying, the time was blessedly lost

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: wherein such preparation was gained. And in him

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: that escapes, it were not sin to think that, making

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: God so free an offer, He let him outlive that day to

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: see His greatness and to teach others how they

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: should prepare.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: ’Tis certain, every man that dies ill, the ill

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: upon his own head; the King is not to answer it.

speaker: BATES
text: I do not desire he should answer for me, and yet

speaker: BATES
text: I determine to fight lustily for him.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: I myself heard the King say he would not

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: be ransomed.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: Ay, he said so to make us fight cheerfully,

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: but when our throats are cut, he may be ransomed

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: and we ne’er the wiser.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: If I live to see it, I will never trust his

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: word after.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: You pay him then. That’s a perilous shot out

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: of an elder gun, that a poor and a private displeasure

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: can do against a monarch. You may as well go

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: about to turn the sun to ice with fanning in his face

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: with a peacock’s feather. You’ll “never trust his

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: word after.” Come, ’tis a foolish saying.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Your reproof is something too round. I

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: should be angry with you if the time were

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: convenient.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: Let it be a quarrel between us, if you live.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: I embrace it.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: How shall I know thee again?

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Give me any gage of thine, and I will wear

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: it in my bonnet. Then, if ever thou dar’st acknowledge

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: it, I will make it my quarrel.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: Here’s my glove. Give me another of thine.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: There.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: This will I also wear in my cap. If ever thou

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: come to me and say, after tomorrow, “This is my

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: glove,” by this hand I will take thee a box on the

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: ear.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: If ever I live to see it, I will challenge it.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: Thou dar’st as well be hanged.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Well, I will do it, though I take thee in the

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: King’s company.

speaker: WILLIAMS
text: Keep thy word. Fare thee well.

speaker: BATES
text: Be friends, you English fools, be friends. We

speaker: BATES
text: have French quarrels enough, if you could tell how

speaker: BATES
text: to reckon.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Indeed, the French may lay twenty

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: French crowns to one they will beat us, for they

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: bear them on their shoulders. But it is no English

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: treason to cut French crowns, and tomorrow the

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: King himself will be a clipper.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Upon the King! Let us our lives, our souls, our

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: debts, our careful wives, our children, and our sins,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: lay on the King!

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text:
We
               
              must
               
              bear
               
              all
              .

              hard
               
              condition
              ,

Twin-born
               
              with

              ,

Of

              his
